commentaries.bbcode: Hello and welcome to Eden Gardens, Kolkata, for Match 25 of the 2015 Pepsi IPL between Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals

message.text: Hello and welcome to Eden Gardens, Kolkata, for Match 25 of the 2015 Pepsi IPL between Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals

commentaries.bbcode:
[b]Preview: [/b]Match 25 of Pepsi IPL 2015 will see the might of Kolkata Knight Riders pitted against the Rajasthan Royals. 
 
 KKR, defending champions, have had a topsy-turvy season so far. They won the season opener before losing their second match. They were back to winning ways in the following two matches, before losing their most-recent match   a rain-affected encounter against Sunrisers Hyderabad. The team, led by Gautam Gambhir, will be concerned by their most-recent performance when they failed to separate the SRH opening pair and allowed them to amass 130 runs on the board. The team s premier spinner   Sunil Narine - has been reported for suspect action, and while he can continue to bowl, the spotlight will be on him; the Trinidadian, who had his action cleared prior to the season, has not had it easy so far   picking up only two wickets in five matches and conceding runs at an economy rate of 7.35   and his task will become that much more difficult with the scrutiny on his action. 
 
 The opening pair of Gautam Gambhir and Robin Uthappa have been the cornerstone of many a KKR victories. Either or both of the openers have generally batted into the second half of the innings, allowing the stroke-makers to flourish at the other end. The team will look to apply that formula yet again. In matches at the Eden Gardens, KKR have relied heavily on their spinners, but they may have to look at other alternatives now. Morne Morkel and Umesh Yadav are the team s top two wicket-takers and they will be expected to bear much more load in the absence of Shakib-al-Hasan and in the circumstance Sunil Narine is faced with. 
 
 The Rajasthan Royals raced away to ten points before their bandwagon was stopped in the Super Over against Kings XI Punjab. In their most recent outing, they struggled to cope with a sluggish surface in Ahmedabad and were at the receiving end of a clinical performance from Royal Challengers Bangalore. There is no denying that conditions made life difficult for batsmen on that occasion, but one would have liked to see better application from the batsmen and that is exactly what would have been spoken in the RR dressing room. 
 
 The Rajasthan Royals too have rode on the performance of their opening pair. Ajinkya Rahane is in the zone many batsmen can only dream of; the Mumbai batsman is testimony to the fact that there is room even for purists in T20 cricket. The 26-year old plays cricket the conventional way, driving the ball along the ground, finding the gaps, rotating the strike over frequently, waiting for the bowler to make a mistake and on the very rare occasion sending the ball over the boundary. He has put a huge price on his wicket and makes bowlers work hard to earn his wicket.

message.text:
Preview: Match 25 of Pepsi IPL 2015 will see the might of Kolkata Knight Riders pitted against the Rajasthan Royals.

KKR, defending champions, have had a topsy-turvy season so far. They won the season opener before losing their second match. They were back to winning ways in the following two matches, before losing their most-recent match – a rain-affected encounter against Sunrisers Hyderabad. The team, led by Gautam Gambhir, will be concerned by their most-recent performance when they failed to separate the SRH opening pair and allowed them to amass 130 runs on the board. The team’s premier spinner – Sunil Narine - has been reported for suspect action, and while he can continue to bowl, the spotlight will be on him; the Trinidadian, who had his action cleared prior to the season, has not had it easy so far – picking up only two wickets in five matches and conceding runs at an economy rate of 7.35 – and his task will become that much more difficult with the scrutiny on his action.

The opening pair of Gautam Gambhir and Robin Uthappa have been the cornerstone of many a KKR victories. Either or both of the openers have generally batted into the second half of the innings, allowing the stroke-makers to flourish at the other end. The team will look to apply that formula yet again. In matches at the Eden Gardens, KKR have relied heavily on their spinners, but they may have to look at other alternatives now. Morne Morkel and Umesh Yadav are the team’s top two wicket-takers and they will be expected to bear much more load in the absence of Shakib-al-Hasan and in the circumstance Sunil Narine is faced with.

The Rajasthan Royals raced away to ten points before their bandwagon was stopped in the Super Over against Kings XI Punjab. In their most recent outing, they struggled to cope with a sluggish surface in Ahmedabad and were at the receiving end of a clinical performance from Royal Challengers Bangalore. There is no denying that conditions made life difficult for batsmen on that occasion, but one would have liked to see better application from the batsmen and that is exactly what would have been spoken in the RR dressing room.

The Rajasthan Royals too have rode on the performance of their opening pair. Ajinkya Rahane is in the zone many batsmen can only dream of; the Mumbai batsman is testimony to the fact that there is room even for purists in T20 cricket. The 26-year old plays cricket the conventional way, driving the ball along the ground, finding the gaps, rotating the strike over frequently, waiting for the bowler to make a mistake and on the very rare occasion sending the ball over the boundary. He has put a huge price on his wicket and makes bowlers work hard to earn his wicket.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]Toss: [/b]Toss delayed due to rain

message.text: Toss: Toss delayed due to rain

commentaries.bbcode: [b]15:25 Local: [/b]Hello, and welcome to Match 25 of this year's Pepsi IPL. Well, I say Match rather loosely as it's raining very heavily at Eden Gardens. The weather that affected KKR's last game has decided to follow Gambhir's side. No official word yet, but it's likely to be a delayed toss.

message.text: 15:25 Local: Hello, and welcome to Match 25 of this year's Pepsi IPL. Well, I say Match rather loosely as it's raining very heavily at Eden Gardens. The weather that affected KKR's last game has decided to follow Gambhir's side. No official word yet, but it's likely to be a delayed toss.

Hope we get something.
#KKRvRR #IPL2015

commentaries.bbcode: [b]15:40 Local: [/b]Still raining sadly. Very heavily too, which is something none of us wanted to see. However, this being cricket, there's always hope of a game, so we'll keep our fingers crossed.

message.text: 15:40 Local: Still raining sadly. Very heavily too, which is something none of us wanted to see. However, this being cricket, there's always hope of a game, so we'll keep our fingers crossed.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]15:45 Local: [/b]It's stopped raining! The sky is clear, but the covers are yet to come off. Much brighter prospect of a game of cricket.

message.text: 15:45 Local: It's stopped raining! The sky is clear, but the covers are yet to come off. Much brighter prospect of a game of cricket.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]16:00 Local: [/b]Well it's definitely stopped raining, but there is so much standing water at Eden Gardens that the covers are barely being moved. A day of being patient I think.

message.text: 16:00 Local: Well it's definitely stopped raining, but there is so much standing water at Eden Gardens that the covers are barely being moved. A day of being patient I think.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]16:15 Local: [/b]Oh no, it's started raining again. Those big covers, which already have enough water on them to fill a swimming pool, won't be moving any time soon.

message.text: 16:15 Local: Oh no, it's started raining again. Those big covers, which already have enough water on them to fill a swimming pool, won't be moving any time soon.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]16:30 Local: [/b]Well, we could still get a full 20 over a side match, as we've got up until 17:15 before we start to lose overs. However, that's looking highly unlikely given that it's still raining. We will keep our fingers crossed though.

message.text: 16:30 Local: Well, we could still get a full 20 over a side match, as we've got up until 17:15 before we start to lose overs. However, that's looking highly unlikely given that it's still raining. We will keep our fingers crossed though.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]16:50 Local: [/b]It's got a little bit lighter, but it's still raining. Everyone's still got their fingers crossed for a game of cricket.

message.text: 16:50 Local: It's got a little bit lighter, but it's still raining. Everyone's still got their fingers crossed for a game of cricket.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]17:00 Local: [/b]Good news - some of the covers are being removed! Still a long clear up job ahead of us, but this is hopeful news.

message.text: 17:00 Local: Good news - some of the covers are being removed! Still a long clear up job ahead of us, but this is hopeful news.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]17:15 Local: [/b]The covers are still being gradually removed. It's still very gloomy, but looks a bit brighter in the distance. There's still a lot of water about at Eden Gardens. If anyone's got a sponge or two, head on down to help!

message.text: 17:15 Local: The covers are still being gradually removed. It's still very gloomy, but looks a bit brighter in the distance. There's still a lot of water about at Eden Gardens. If anyone's got a sponge or two, head on down to help!

commentaries.bbcode: [b]17:20 Local: [/b]More news - an official inspection will be at [b]17:35 Local[/b]. Still a long clear up job ahead of us, but things definitely look a bit more optimistic.

message.text: 17:20 Local: More news - an official inspection will be at 17:35 Local. Still a long clear up job ahead of us, but things definitely look a bit more optimistic.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]17:45 Local: [/b]I come bearing news, but sadly it's not as positive as we had hoped. The ground's still very wet, so the umpires have decided the next inspection will be at [b]18:20 Local.[/b] With Eden Gardens being a pitched that dries quickly, we will still hopefully get a game of cricket.

message.text: 17:45 Local: I come bearing news, but sadly it's not as positive as we had hoped. The ground's still very wet, so the umpires have decided the next inspection will be at 18:20 Local. With Eden Gardens being a pitched that dries quickly, we will still hopefully get a game of cricket.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]18:25 Local: [/b]The wait goes on. The umpires have decided that there will be another inspection at [b]18:45 Local[/b]. Eden Gardens is packed to the rafters, but the outfield is still looking quite damp.

message.text: 18:25 Local: The wait goes on. The umpires have decided that there will be another inspection at 18:45 Local. Eden Gardens is packed to the rafters, but the outfield is still looking quite damp.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]18:45 Local: [/b]The tense wait for cricket continues. A further inspection will take place at [b]18:50 Local[/b].

message.text: 18:45 Local: The tense wait for cricket continues. A further inspection will take place at 18:50 Local.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]19:00 Local: [/b]There have been several discussions between the umpires, the captains, the coaches and the curator. Still no official word yet on whether there will be a game.

message.text: 19:00 Local: There have been several discussions between the umpires, the captains, the coaches and the curator. Still no official word yet on whether there will be a game.

commentaries.bbcode: [b]Match abandoned without a ball bowled[/b]

message.text: Match abandoned without a ball bowled

commentaries.bbcode:
[b]Match Report: [/b]The Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals shared points after their match at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata was washed out by torrential showers. After several inspections by the Umpires   Richard Illingworth and Rajesh Deshpande   and hours of hard work by the ground staff who attempted to get the ground ready, the match was eventually declared abandoned. 
 
 KKR will feel hard done by. The defending champions have a history of doing well at home, and would have expected to bag full points from the match. They now have three wins from six outings with seven points on the board. 
 
 RR, who came into the match at the back of a dismal showing against Royal Challengers Bangalore, will feel they have been denied the opportunity to get back on tracks. They go back to top of the table with 11 points, courtesy their five wins and the one point from today s match. 
 
 KKR take on the Chennai Super Kings next, while Rajasthan Royals head to Bengaluru to take on Royal Challengers Bangalore.

message.text:
Match Report: The Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals shared points after their match at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata was washed out by torrential showers. After several inspections by the Umpires – Richard Illingworth and Rajesh Deshpande – and hours of hard work by the ground staff who attempted to get the ground ready, the match was eventually declared abandoned.

KKR will feel hard done by. The defending champions have a history of doing well at home, and would have expected to bag full points from the match. They now have three wins from six outings with seven points on the board.

RR, who came into the match at the back of a dismal showing against Royal Challengers Bangalore, will feel they have been denied the opportunity to get back on tracks. They go back to top of the table with 11 points, courtesy their five wins and the one point from today’s match.

KKR take on the Chennai Super Kings next, while Rajasthan Royals head to Bengaluru to take on Royal Challengers Bangalore.

commentaries.bbcode: \n\nSo sadly, the weather has won in the battle at Eden Gardens. A great shame for all the fans, as this had the potential to be a cracking match. A point for both sides, and they can now go and put their feet up and watch DD and RCB do battle. The toss is not far away, so make sure you head over there.

message.text: So sadly, the weather has won in the battle at Eden Gardens. A great shame for all the fans, as this had the potential to be a cracking match. A point for both sides, and they can now go and put their feet up and watch DD and RCB do battle. The toss is not far away, so make sure you head over there.
